intro: Carpoceras longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled carpoceras, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with serrated edges, and the flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. The fruit is a small, dry schizocarp that splits into two parts when mature.
